verses.verse: {Sins that Separate from God} d "See, the Lord's hand is not too short to save, nor are his ears {So 1QIsa a ; MT LXX read ear} too dull to hear.
Instead, your iniquities have been barriers between you and your God, and your sins have concealed his face from you so that he won't listen.
For your hands are defiled with blood, and your fingers with iniquity; your tongue {So 1QIsa a ; MT LXX read your lips have spoken lies, your tongue} mutters wickedness.

No one brings a lawsuit fairly, and no one goes to law honestly; they have relied {So 1QIsa a 1QIsa b ; MT reads they rely} on empty arguments and they tell lies; they conceive {So 1QIsa a ; 1QIsa b MT reads to conceive} trouble and give birth {So 1QIsa a 1QIsa b ; MT reads and to give birth} to iniquity.

They hatch {So 1QIsa a ; 1QIsa b MT reads They have hatched ; LXX reads hatched} adders'eggs {So 1QIsa a LXX; 1QIsa b MT read an adder's eggs} and weave {So 1QIsa a ; MT reads weave , but with a different Heb. word} a spider's web; whoever eats their eggs dies, and any crushed egg hatches out futility. {Lit. a viper ; so 1QIsa a ; 1QIsa b MT LXX utilize feminine form}
Their cobwebs cannot become clothing, they cannot cover themselves with what they make. Their deeds are deeds of iniquity, and acts of violence fill their hands.

Their feet rush to evil, and they are quick to shed innocent blood. Their thoughts are thoughts of iniquity; ruin, destruction, and violence {So 1QIsa a ; MT LXX lack and violence} are in their paths.
The pathway of peace they do not know, and there is no justice in their courses. They have made their roads crooked; no one who walks in them will know peace."

{A Commitment to Wait on God} d "So justice is far from us, and righteousness does not reach us. We wait for light, but look there is darkness; we wait for brightness, but we walk in deep darkness. {So 1QIsa a LXX; MT reads darknesses}

Let's grope {So 1QIsa a ; MT reads We grope LXX reads They grope} along the wall like the blind; let us grope like those who have no eyes. We stumble at midday as if it were twilight, in desolate places {Or among vigorous people} like dead people.
We all growl like bears; we {So 1QIsa a ; MT reads and we} sigh mournfully like doves. We look for justice, but there is none, and {So 1QIsa a ; Not in MT LXX} for deliverance, but it's far from us.

"For our transgressions before you are many, and our sins testify {1QIsa a cf. LXX; MT reads sin testifies} against us; for our transgressions are with us, and as for our iniquities, we acknowledge them:

they've rebelled {So 1QIsa a ; MT reads rebellion LXX reads we have sinned} in {Lit. and} treachery against the Lord , and are turning away from following our God; and they've spoken {So 1QIsa a ; MT reads speaking LXX reads we have spoken} oppression and revolt, and are conceiving {So 1QIsa a ; MT reads conceiving and uttering ; LXX reads we have conceived and thought about} lying words from the heart.

I'll drive back justice, {So 1QIsa a ; MT reads Justice is driven back LXX reads We withdrew justice} and righteousness stands at a distance; for truth has fallen in the public square, and honesty cannot enter.
Truth is missing, and whoever turns away from evil becomes a prey." {God Brings His Own Salvation} d"Then the Lord looked, and it displeased him that there was no justice.
He saw that there was no one, and was appalled that there was no one to intervene; so his own arm {I. e. the Messiah} brought him victory, and his righteous acts upheld him.
He put on righteousness like a breastplate, and a helmet of salvation on his head; he put on garments of vengeance for clothing, and wrapped himself in fury like a cloak.
So he will repay according to their action: Anger to his enemies, retribution to his foes; to the coastlands he will render their due.

So people will fear the name of the Lord from the west, and his glories {So 1QIsa a ; MT reads glory LXX reads his glorious name} from the rising of the sun; for he will come as a pent-up stream that the breath of the Lord drives along.
"And a Redeemer will come to Zion, to those in Jacob who turn from transgression,"says the Lord .

"As for me, this is my covenant with them,"{So 1QIsa a MT mss LXX; 1QIsa b MT read them , but the reading contains a grammatical object error} says the Lord . "And {So 1QIsa a ; 1QIsa b MT LXX lack And} my Spirit that is upon you, and my words that I have put in your mouth, won't depart from your mouth, or from the mouths of your children, or from the mouths of your children's children, {So 1QIsa a ; 1QIsa b MT LXX read children, says the Lord,} from now on and forever."
